newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila shares end up on corporate results.
newsitem.headline: Manila shares end up on corporate results.

text.p: * ALI B leads blue chips in pulling index up
Manila shares finished up on Thursday buoyed by bargain hunting in blue chips with good nine-month corporate earnings, traders said.
The main index nudged up at the close by 36.70 points, or 1.25 percent, to 2,964 points.
"All of a sudden, there's this delayed reaction of the market with buying of blue chips with good earnings, said Cilette Liboro, research head at Citisecurities Inc.
Ayala Land B which reported a 34 percent hike in nine months profits led the technical rally on Thursday ending 50 centavos up at 28 pesos.
Other issues which propelled the market up were San Miguel Corp and Petron Corp.
Trading volume was heavy at 3.6 billion pesos prompting some analysts to say that foreign investors may have returned.
Gainers exceeded losers at 76 to 38 with 65 issues unchanged.
The modest rally will likely continue up to early next week with the index tredding between 3,000 to 3,050 points, Fritz Aclan, research head at Dharmala Securities Phils Inc said.
